page.title: 11Primary School, Bodenham
page.content: St Michael's C.E. Primary School, Bodenham, jointly owned by the County Council and the Church, was founded in 1863. New buildings were added in 1971 including a new hall, kitchen, toilets staffroom, office, and 4 classrooms. There are 98 children and 4 teachers: Mr Herbert - Headmaster - Class 1 Miss Holme - Class 2 Mrs Chatfield - Deputy Head - Class 3 Mrs Griffiths - Reception Class 4 Mrs Wilson - Ancillary Helper Mrs Clarke cooks lunches helped by Mrs Bealing who also works in the office. Mrs Wilson and Mrs Kendall are Dinner Ladies.The cleaners Mrs Paterson, Mrs Stocker and Mrs Ankers take a great pride in the school. The school is used in the evenings for aerobics,keep fit,country dancing,Sunday School and meetings.The playground and field are used for various sports and playtime.
